info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud CX Sales - Product Structures
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Sales and Service â€” Product Structures module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Product Structures

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the bill sequence. A value that uniquely identifies the structure. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified only if the resource is already modified.
(Required) Value that uniquely identifies the component in a structure. This attribute is read-only and is not required for an update operation.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • BOMItemType; number; The type of bill of material associated with the cpomponent such as standard, model, planning, and other.
  • BillSequenceId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the bill of material. This is the foreign key to the Structure view object. This attribute is read-only, and can be modified only if the resource is already modified.
  • Comments; string; An attribute value that represents comments about a component.
  • ComponentItemDescription; string; The description of the item associated with the component.
  • ComponentItemId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the item associated with the component.
  • ComponentItemName; string; The name of the item associated with the component.
  • ComponentItemNumber; string; An attribute that represents the item number of a component. This attribute is only updatable for a create operation, otherwise is read only.
  • ComponentOrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise. Organization structure provides the framework for performing legal reporting, financial control, and management reporting. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
  • ComponentSequenceId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the component in a structure. This attribute is read-only and is not required for an update operation.
  • ComponentStructureItemTypeValue; string; Value that identifies whether the component sub-assembly is date effective or is model or unit effective.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the component.
  • CreationDateTime; string; The date and time when the structure was created.
  • CustomerOrderEnabledFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the custom order is enabled. The values are true and false. If true, then the item can be ordered by external customers at this point of time. If false, then the item can't be ordered by external customers at this point of time. The default value is false. For a list of attribute value interdependencies, refer to Interdependent Item Attributes in Using Product Master Data Management Guide.
  • EndDateTime; string; The date and time when a component in a structure ends.
  • ImplementationDateTime; string; This attributes provides the timestamp when the component was implemented as production row. This attribute can be used to differentiate among pending and production components. For pending components this will be null. This is read only attribute.
  • ItemSequenceNumber; number; A unique number which defines the sequence of components in a structure.
  • LastUpdateDateTime; string; The date and time when the structure was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login of the user who last updated the component.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the component.
  • MaximumQuantity; number; An attribute that value indicates the maximum quantity allowed on an order.
  • MinimumQuantity; number; An attribute that value indicates the minimum quantity allowed on an order.
  • MutuallyExclusiveFlag; boolean; Indicates whether one or more options under this Option Class can be chosen.
  • OptionalFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the component is optional for a structure.
  • OrganizationId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the organization.
  • PrimaryUOMCode; string; Primary unit of measure for the item quantities.
  • Quantity; number; An attribute value the represents the quantity of component item used.
  • SoBasis; number; Value that indicates the basis to override the default quantity for the option class when a sales order is entered (the default), for components of the BOM Item Type option class. The option class quantities affect the mandatory standard components assigned to the option class.
  • StartDateTime; string; The date and time when a component in a structure begins.
  • StructureItemNumber; string; Number that identifies a part, material, product, or service. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
  • StructureOrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise. Organization structure provides the framework for performing legal reporting, financial control, and management reporting. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
  • WIPSupplyType; integer; Type of supply for components.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds a component with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • ComponentSequenceId; integer; The unique identifier of the component.
  • getComponentByItemNumber: Finds a component with specified structure item number and component item number.
    Finder Variables:
    • ComponentItemNumber; string; The component item number that identifies a part, material, product, or service.
    • ComponentOrganizationCode; string; The component organization code that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise.
    • StructureItemNumber; string; The structure item number that identifies a part, material, product, or service.
    • StructureOrganizationCode; string; The structure organization code that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise.

For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

header.description: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

Example:

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • BillSequenceId; integer; The unique identifier of the bill sequence. A value that uniquely identifies the structure. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified only if the resource is already modified.
  • CommonItemNumber; string; The number that identifies the item for the common structure. This attribute is read-only.
  • CommonOrganizationCode; string; The name of the organization for the common structure. This attribute is read-only.
  • CreatedBy; string; The user who created the structure.
  • CreationDateTime; string; The date and time when the structure was created.
  • Description; string; The description for structure.
  • ItemId; string; The unique identifier of the part, item, product, or service.
  • ItemNumber; string; The number that identifies a part, material, product, or service. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
  • LastUpdateDateTime; string; The date and time when the structure was last updated.
  • LastUpdateLogin; string; The login of the user who last updated the structure.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; The user who last updated the structure.
  • OrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise. Organization structure provides the framework for performing legal reporting, financial control, and management reporting. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
  • OrganizationId; string; The unique identifier of the organization.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • AltKey: Finds a product structure with the specified value.
    Finder Variables:
    • ItemId; string.
    • OrganizationId; string.
  • PrimaryKey: Finds a product structure with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • BillSequenceId; integer; The unique identifier of the product structure.
  • getStructureByItemNumber: Finds a product structure with specified item number.
    Finder Variables:
    • ItemNumber; string; The number that identifies a part, material, product, or service. This attribute is read-only, which can be modified for the create operation.
    • OrganizationCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the name of an organizing unit in the internal or external organization structure of your enterprise.

item.description: The product structures resource is used to view, create, and update the details of a product structure. It is used to include a primary structure that is used to build the item or an alternate structure.
